pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.2: At that time a certain monk who was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī was given some wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.3: He bound it into a bundle with his upper robe and went on.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.4: People who saw him teased him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.5: “Venerable, how much did this cost you?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.6: How much will the profit be?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.7: As a result he was humiliated.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.8: When he arrived at Sāvatthī, he threw the wool to the ground.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.11: “People have been teasing me because of this wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.12: “But how far have you carried it?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.14: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.15: “How can a monk carry wool more than 40 kilometers?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.16: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.17: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.20: “… Foolish man, how can you carry wool more than 40 kilometers?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.21: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.22: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.23.1: ‘If wool is given to a monk who is traveling, he may receive it if he wishes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.24: If he receives it and there is no one else to carry it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.25: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.1: To a monk who is traveling:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.4: if it is given by the Sangha, by a group, by a relative, by a friend, or if it is discarded wool, or if it is by means of his own property.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.6: if he desires, he may receive it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.7: If he receives it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.8: he may carry it himself no further than 40 kilometers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.9: There is no one else to carry it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.10: there is no other person who can carry it, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or a monastic.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.11: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.12: when he goes beyond 40 kilometers with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.13: When he goes beyond with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.14: If he stands within the 40 kilometer limit, but drops it beyond the 40 kilometer limit, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.15: If he places it in the vehicle or among the goods of another without their knowledge, and it goes more than 40 kilometers, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.16: The wool should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.17: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.18: (To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5--3.2.29), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.19: ‘Venerables, this wool which I have taken more than 40 kilometers is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.20: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.23: ‘I give this wool back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.24.1: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.25: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.26: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.27: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.28: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.29: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.32: if he carries it less than 40 kilometers;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.33: if he carries it 40 kilometers and then carries it back;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.34: if he takes it 40 kilometers with the intention of staying there, but then takes it further;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.35: if he gets back what had been taken from him and then carries it on;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.36: if he gets back what he had given up and then carries it on;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.37: if he gets someone else to carry it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.38: if it is a finished article;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.40: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.41: The sixth rule, the training rule on wool, is finished.
